info.title: Upbots API
info.description: Web api offering data to the Upbots front web application.

apiKeyRef.description: crypto exchange api key internal upbots identifier

symbol.description: symbol pair indentifier for a particular exchange (BASE QUOTE concatenated), i.e., XBTUSD fo bitmex_test), BTCUSDT for binance

quantity.description: total quantity in BASE units (if multi-entry mode, this quantity must equal to the sum of entries volume

apiKeyRef.description: crypto exchange api key internal upbots identifier

symbol.description: symbol pair indentifier for a particular exchange (BASE QUOTE concatenated), i.e., XBTUSD fo bitmex_test), BTCUSDT for binance

get.summary: Get portfolio evolution for a given user.
get.description:
For a given user, return the portfolio evolution valued in BTC, EUR and USD.

      Supports filters on start and end date.
      At least one param start or end is mandatory.

      Can also specify accounts to return, but will return all user's accounts by default.

parameters.name: accountsIds
parameters.description: Only accepts array of Mongo Object Id in comma separator format

200.description:
For a given user:
      
      - Returns aggregated portfolio value evolution (BTC, EUR, USD) in time.
      - Returns portfolio value evolution (BTC, EUR, USD) in time per account.

get.summary: Get the current price of any crypto currencies in any other supported currencies with CoinGecko API V3
Get historical market data include price, market cap, and 24h volumn with CoinGecko API V3
Get historical market data include price and market cap with Binance
Get Upbots exchange settings
get.description:
Get the settings of exchanges in upbots.

        1) Gets the list of exchanges that upbots allows you to connect to. As a user, you can record API keys from those exchanges.

        2) For each exchange, it returns the pairs for which you can create trade orders.

        Note: data are seeded by the SeedModule.

200.description: Return application settings for exchanges (allowed exchanges and pairs for trading)

get.summary: Get Contract size
Get Upbots pages settings
get.description:
Get the settings of pages in upbots.

        For each route of the app, indicates whether the page is coming soon

        Note: data are seeded by the SeedModule.

get.summary: For a given exchange, get the list of rules to respect for orders formats (price/amount)
get.description:
For a given exchange, return the list of rules to respect for orders formats (price/amount).
      When sending a trade to an exchange, those rules must be respected. Otherwise, the exchange will reject the order.

      The route supports filters on market or symbol where:
      - market is the pair label on the exchange (e.g. BTC/USD)
      - symbol is the id of the pair (e.g. XBTUSD)

      e.g. : on bitmex "Bitcoin perpetual future contract" market is BTC/USD and symbol is XBTUSD.

parameters.name: markets
parameters.description: Array of strings comma-delimited. Can be upper or lower case.

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Array of strings comma-delimited. Can be upper or lower case.

post.summary: Check if the key is valid and update "valid" status
post.description:
Check if the key is valid. 
      If yes, it does enable or keep enabled the key.
      If no, it disable or keep disabled the key.

post.summary: Check all the invalid keys and update "valid" status

post.description: Add a new trade request to the trading engine

get.summary: For a given symbol from a given exchange, check whether the order format complies with the exchange's rules.
get.description:
For a given symbol from a given exchange, check whether the order format complies with the exchange's rules.
      When sending a trade to an exchange, certain rules must be respected. Otherwise, the exchange will reject the order.

      If the trade order is not compliant, the api returns a compliant format suggestion.

parameters.name: symbol

get.summary: For a given symbol from a given exchange, check whether the price format complies with the exchange's rules.
get.description:
For a given symbol from a given exchange, check whether the price format complies with the exchange's rules.
      When sending a trade to an exchange, certain rules must be respected. Otherwise, the exchange will reject the order.

      If the trade price is not compliant, the api returns a compliant format suggestion.

parameters.name: symbol

get.summary: For a given symbol from a given exchange, check whether the quantity format complies with the exchange's rules.
get.description:
For a given symbol from a given exchange, check whether the quantity format complies with the exchange's rules.
      When sending a trade to an exchange, certain rules must be respected. Otherwise, the exchange will reject the order.

      If the trade quantity is not compliant, the api returns a compliant format suggestion.

parameters.name: symbol

get.summary: Get the balances and defi projects of a list of addresses.
get.description:
For a given eth address, returns a list of all ERC20 and defi projects balances along with their current spot prices.

      Requires the list of addresses for which we should get the balances and the defi projects.

200.description: Returns a list of all ERC20 and NFT token balances along with their current spot prices.

get.summary: Get transactions history for an eth address in all supported tokens
get.description:
For a given eth address, returns a list of all ERC20 and NFT token previous transactions.

      Requires the address for which we should get the transactions.

      Support an optional chain filter to query either the default Eth Mainnet or Matic, by default returns the results from the Eth Mainnet.
      Support an optional nft filter to decide whether it returns nft tokens or not, which is true by default.

200.description: Returns a list of all ERC20 and NFT token balances along with their current spot prices.
